definition: ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
hole/opening/orifice (of the human body)/(fig.) key (to the solution of a problem)

sentences.english: She had never been so crushed.
sentences.chinese: 她从来没有这么鬼迷心窍过。

sentences.english: Nowadays, many girls seem to have a bee in their bonnets and they are determined to marry foreigners.
sentences.chinese: 最近许多女孩都鬼迷心窍似的一心只想嫁个外国人。

sentences.english: She must have been possessed, to attack her own mother.
sentences.chinese: 她准是鬼迷心窍，竟然打自己的妈妈。

sentences.english: You must either be mad or utterly depraved and wicked.
sentences.chinese: 你一定是疯了，要不就是中了邪，鬼迷心窍。

definition: (idiom) blind as a bat (figuratively)/unaware of who (or what) one is dealing with/to fail to recognize what sb a bit more perceptive would
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
a single slip may cause everlasting sorrow (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 shi1 zu2 cheng2 qian1 gu3 hen4
